account.api_key.help: Cloudflare provisions two separate API keys for your Cloudflare account. The Global API Key is an all purpose token that can read and edit any data or settings that you can access in the dashboard. The Origin CA Key is for one function only u2014 it can be used to generate TLS certificates for any of your websites on Cloudflare which are only trusted by Cloudflare, but not to read or change any other settings. This is to help keep your websites safe. Origin CA Keys often get deployed on public servers, and in case of compromise, none of your other Cloudflare settings would be accessible.

account.dpa.card.custom: A custom Data Processing Addendum was agreed to. Contact eu.dpa@cloudflare.com with questions.
account.dpa.card.description:
We have updated our data processing addendum (DPA). If you are a customer under our self-serve agreement or if you agreed to our standard Enterprise agreement on or after Aug. 8, 2019, you do not need to take any action because our standard DPA is incorporated by reference into those agreements.

For customers who entered into an Enterprise agreement prior to Aug. 8, 2019, if the EU General Data Protection (GDPR) applies to your organization, you must review and agree to our Data Processing Addendum, which incorporates the standard contractual clauses. [Learn more](https://www.cloudflare.com/gdpr/introduction/).
account.dpa.card.description_2023: Cloudflareu2019s Data Processing Addendum is incorporated into both our [Self-Serve Subscription Agreement](https://www.cloudflare.com/terms/) and our standard [Enterprise Subscription Terms of Service](https://www.cloudflare.com/enterpriseterms/). For customers with negotiated Enterprise Agreements, you can obtain a copy of your Data Processing Addendum by contacting your Account representative.
account.dpa.card.description_2024: Cloudflareu2019s Data Processing Addendum is incorporated into both our <0>Self-Serve Subscription Agreement</0> and our standard <1>Enterprise Subscription Terms of Service</1>. For customers who entered into an Enterprise agreement prior to Aug. 8, 2019, if the EU General Data Protection (GDPR) applies to your organization, you must review and agree to our new Data Processing Addendum because incorporates the standard contractual clauses for EU personal data. [Learn more](https://www.cloudflare.com/gdpr/introduction/).

account.magic_transit.healthchecks.title: Magic Transit Healthchecks
account.magic_transit.healthchecks.descr:
Tunnel health checks monitor the status of Anycast tunnels that route traffic from Cloudflare to your origin network.
Magic Transit uses health checks to steer traffic to the best available routes.
account.magic_transit.healthchecks.help_:
**What are tunnel health checks?**
Tunnel health checks monitor the status of Anycast tunnels that route traffic from Cloudflare to your origin network. Magic Transit relies on health checks to steer traffic to the best available routes.

Tunnel probes originate from Cloudflareu2019s edge network and target the GRE tunnel endpoints you supply during the Magic Transit onboarding process. These results are aggregated from individual health check results done on Cloudflare servers. Learn more [here](https://developers.cloudflare.com/magic-transit/about/health-checks#tunnel-health-checks).

account.magic.packet_captures.captures.c: Full packet captures and sampled packet captures can collect packet level data of your Magic Transit and Magic WAN traffic.

A <1>sample packet capture</1> looks back in time and collects sampled data of packets that have already passed through Magic Transit or Magic WAN. Sample packet captures are great for quick troubleshooting of historical traffic. Sample packet captures will complete immediately after they are started. The sampled packet data includes the packet header and the first 100 bytes of packet data. Your five most recent sample packet captures from the past 24 hours will be available for download in the dashboard.

A <1>full packet capture</1> will collect packet level data of your Magic Transit and Magic WAN traffic. Full packet captures are best for targeted data collection of live network traffic. To start a full packet capture, you are required to first add a <3>cloud storage bucket</3>. Data collection begins when you start the packet capture and ends when the data collection limit is reached or you stop the packet capture. The result of the packet capture is contained within one or more files in the PCAP file format. These files are placed in your cloud storage bucket.

account.magic.network_monitoring.onboard: Magic Network Monitoring provides better visibility into the way that your network is operating. This product will receive NetFlow / sFlow data from your router(s), and display network analytics on traffic volume, source IP, destination IP, TCP flags, and other statistics. You can also create alerts based on traffic volume thresholds for specific destination IPs. Cloudflare is committed to communicating transparently, providing security, and protecting the privacy of data on our systems. You can read more about Cloudflareu2019s Privacy Policy.

You can start using Magic Network Monitoring for free today.
Learn more

yubico_promo.card.title: Exclusive 'good for the Internet' pricing on security keys
yubico_promo.card.description_p1: Cloudflare has partnered with Yubico to offer hardware authentication security keys at a promotional price to eligible Cloudflare customers. Select "Claim my offer" and Yubico will email the offer to the email address associated with your account if you are eligible. Eligible customers must have an active zone or actively use Cloudflare Zero Trust. You may not claim this offer multiple times from the same email and this offer may be restricted to one email per account. Cloudflare may modify, limit, or discontinue this promotion at any time. Offer is subject to Yubico's terms.
yubico_promo.card.description_p2: Learn more about how Cloudflare Zero Trust makes it easy to activate and authenticate using your hardware security keys with any identity provider for more secure access to any self-hosted or SaaS application.
yubico_promo.card.description_legal: By clicking "Claim my offer", you consent to Cloudflare sharing your email address with Yubico AB, Yubico GmbH, Yubico Inc. and Yubico Canada Inc. account.secondary_dns.acl.card.descripti: Configuring an Access Control List (ACL) has two purposes, to specify:

2. IPs that Cloudflare allows zone transfer requests from for primary zones.

account.secondary_dns.peers.card.title: Peer DNS servers
account.secondary_dns.peers.card.descrip: Peer DNS servers can be used as primary and secondary external DNS servers. The same peer can be linked to multiple primary and secondary zones. Each peer can be associated with only one TSIG.
Do you want to delete this Peer DNS Server?

Deleting a Peer DNS server affects all zones in your account that are linked to it. If this is the only Peer DNS server that a secondary zone is linked to, the secondary zone's DNS records will no longer be in sync with the primary after deletion.
account.secondary_dns.peers.card.help: To learn more about how to set up peer DNS servers, check out the [developer documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/dns/zone-setups/zone-transfers/#peer-dns-server).

Cloudflare's AXFR/IXFR zone transfer requests originate from the following IP prefixes. These ranges need to be allowed at your Primary DNS servers.
Notify IPs are the IP addresses where you notify Cloudflare's Secondary DNS to initiate a pull of new zone information from your Primary DNS servers.
account.secondary_dns.peers.form.acl.sec: This is required if you are using Cloudflare for Primary DNS.
Cloudflare's NOTIFY messages originate from the following IP prefixes. These ranges need to be allowed at your Secondary DNS servers.
Cloudflare will listen to AXFR/IXFR zone transfer requests and SOA queries from your Secondary DNS server on this IP address.

account.ddos.page.title: Cloudflare's automated DDoS Protection systems constantly detect and mitigate DDoS attacks targeting your Internet properties.
account.ddos.page.description: Cloudflare's automated DDoS Protection systems constantly detect and mitigate DDoS attacks targeting your Internet properties.
account.ddos.rulesets.description:
Ruleset managed by Cloudflare that automatically detects and mitigates L3/4 DDoS attacks such as UDP floods, SYN-ACK reflection attacks, and DNS amplification attacks.

 Network-layer DDoS protection is always enabled. To customize the ruleset behavior, create a DDoS override.
account.ddos.rulesets.help:
**Is protection enabled by default?**
Yes. You donu2019t need to create a Network-layer DDoS Managed Ruleset override to enable the protection. The protection is enabled by default. If you are experiencing false positives or need to make any changes to the rule action, sensitivity level of expression fields, deploy a new override with your desired changes.

**What is a Distributed Denial of Service attack?**
A [Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/ddos/what-is-a-ddos-attack/) is a malicious attempt to disrupt the normal traffic of a targeted server, service or network by overwhelming the target or its surrounding infrastructure with a flood of Internet traffic.

**How does Cloudflare protect me against a DDoS attack?**
Cloudflareu2019s [autonomous DDoS protection systems](https://blog.cloudflare.com/deep-dive-cloudflare-autonomous-edge-ddos-protection/) use a set of dynamic rules that scan for attack patterns, known attack tools, suspicious patterns, protocol violations, out-of-state packets, and additional attack vectors. Each rule has a predefined sensitivity level and default action that varies based on the ruleu2019s confidence that the traffic is indeed part of an attack.

**Available actions**
* **Block** - Blocks IP packets that match the rule expression given the sensitivity levels.
* **Log** - Logs packets that match the expression of a rule detecting layer 3/4 DDoS attacks. Recommended for validating a rule before committing to a more severe action.
* **DDoS Dynamic** - Performs a specific action according to a set of internal guidelines defined by Cloudflare. The executed action can be Block or an undisclosed mitigation action.

Read more about the actions [here](https://developers.cloudflare.com/ddos-protection/managed-rulesets/network/override-parameters/#action).

**Available sensitivity levels**
* High
* Medium
* Low
* Essentially Off

Read more about the sensitivity levels [here](https://developers.cloudflare.com/ddos-protection/managed-rulesets/network/override-parameters/#sensitivity-level).

**Available expression fields**
You can use expression fields to exclude or include certain traffic from the Network-layer DDoS Protection Managed Ruleset. The supported fields include the source IP, source port, destination IP, destination port, packet length, TTL and more. View [all available expression fields](https://developers.cloudflare.com/ddos-protection/managed-rulesets/network/override-expressions/).

**Notes:**
* **Essentially Off** means that weu2019ve set an exceptionally low sensitivity level so in most cases traffic wonu2019t be mitigated for you. However, attack traffic will be mitigated at exceptional levels to ensure the safety and stability of the Cloudflare network.
* **Log** means that packets wonu2019t be mitigated but only logged and shown in the dashboard. However, attack traffic will be mitigated at exceptional levels to ensure the safety and stability of the Cloudflare network.

**Additional resources**
* [Learn more about the Network-layer DDoS Protection Managed Rules](https://developers.cloudflare.com/ddos-protection/managed-rulesets/network/)
* [Learning Center](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/ddos/what-is-a-ddos-attack/)
* [Overview of Cloudflare DDoS Protection](https://developers.cloudflare.com/ddos-protection/)
* [How to handle false positives or false negatives](https://developers.cloudflare.com/ddos-protection/managed-rulesets/adjust-rules/)
* [Simulating test DDoS attacks](https://developers.cloudflare.com/ddos-protection/reference/simulate-ddos-attack/)

api_tokens.title: API Tokens
api_tokens.description: Manage access and permissions for your accounts, sites, and products
api_tokens.help:
API Tokens use the standard Authorization: Bearer header for authentication instead of `x-auth-email` and `x-auth-key` that API Keys use. Requests can be authenticated like the following:

```
curl -X GET "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/cd7d0123e3012345da9420df9514dad0" \ 
-H "Content-Type:application/json" \ 
-H "Authorization: Bearer 1234567893feefc5f0q5000bfo0c38d90bbeb"
```

For additional information see the [API Request documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/fundamentals/api/).

billing.lego_contract_agreement_descript: By clicking the ACCEPT button below you are: (i) agreeing to amend the Enterprise Subscription Terms of Service ("Agreement") that your company, organization, or other legal entity (each, an "Entity") entered into with Cloudflare and pursuant to which the Entity is receiving Cloudflare's services ("Service(s)"); and (ii) representing to Cloudflare that you have the authority to bind such Entity to this Agreement, in which case the terms "you" and "your" will refer to such Entity. All capitalized terms not defined herein have the meaning assigned to them in the Agreement. After clicking the ACCEPT button your Agreement with Cloudflare will be deemed to have been amended to permit any employees, agents or subcontractors who have administrative access to your instance of the Cloudflare Service (each, an "Authorized User") to use the Service's in-dashboard ordering capabilities to add new Services and Service allotments to your account without entering into a written order form for such Services (each, a "Self-Enabled Enterprise Service"). Self-Enabled Enterprise Services may be purchased by Authorized Users on either a month-to-month or an annualized basis. Self-Enabled Enterprise Services purchased on a month-to-month basis may be cancelled at any time during the Term using the cancellation mechanism provided in the Service's dashboard. Cloudflare will charge you for the entire month for any Self-Enabled Enterprise Services that you cancel mid-month. Cloudflare will bill the credit card provided by the Authorized User (if any) on a monthly recurring basis for those Self-Enabled Enterprise Services purchased on a month-to-month basis beginning on the same day that the Authorized User enables the Self-Enabled Enterprise Services, regardless of whether you have fully configured the Self-Enabled Enterprise Services as of that date. Self-Enabled Enterprise Services purchased on an annualized basis will be invoiced by adding a fee to your regular invoice in an amount that is equal to the list price that was presented to the Authorized User in the Service's dashboard at the time of purchase. Self-Enabled Enterprise Services added on an annualized basis will not extend the Term of the Agreement, and will end concurrently with your company's other Services. Unless your company provides written notice of its intent to cancel the Self-Enabled Enterprise Services that were purchased on an annualized basis at least sixty (60) days prior to the expiration of the Initial Term or then current Renewal Term, the Self-Enabled Enterprise Services will automatically renew for another one year period. If you do not wish to amend the Agreement as described above, or you do not have the authority to amend the agreement, then you must NOT click the ACCEPT button.
billing.lego_contract_signup_form_descri: We need contact information for an approver from your organization who is authorized to review and sign a one-time addendum. This agreement will authorize your Cloudflare users (with billing administrative permissions) to add new services that can either be purchased month-to-month or be added on to your existing contract with Cloudflare based on the list price presented prior to the time of purchasing.

We will not send marketing materials to any email address provided unless they have opted in to receive marketing materials. We cannot enable new services to your contract or purchased for a month-to-month subscription until we receive a signature.
Month-to-month subscriptions can be cancelled at any time on the Cloudflare dashboard.

Services being added to your contract will not extend the current contract but instead will be up for renewal with all your other services. Any cancellations must be negotiated before the 60-day renewal period.
Pricing can only be negotiated for services added to the contract. If you are interested, please contact your Account Manager.
You may switch from a month-to-month subscription to a contracted subscription at any time. If you are interested, please contact your Account Manager or support contact.

billing.lego_contract.card.description.a: Access protects internal resources by authenticating against identity providers you already use. With Access, you can control which users and groups can reach sensitive materials without a VPN or making code changes to your site.
billing.lego_contract.card.signed.rate_l: Note: Your request has been approved. You may now enable Rate Limiting.
billing.lego_contract.card.description.r:
Protect your site or API from malicious traffic by blocking client IP addresses that hit a URL pattern and exceed a threshold you define. This feature is a usage-based product.

Learn more about how [billing](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115000272247) works for Rate Limiting.
billing.lego_contract.card.signed.load_b: Note: Your request has been approved. You may now enable Load Balancing.
billing.lego_contract.card.description.l:
Safeguard from service disruptions with load balancing, automatic failover, geographic routing and active health checks against your origin servers.

Learn more about how [billing](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115005254367) works for Load Balancing.
billing.lego_contract.card.signed.stream: Note: Your request has been approved. You may now enable Stream.
billing.lego_contract.card.description.s:
Stream is a video platform for developers. Upload a video and Cloudflare will encode, process and deliver it on all browsers and devices.

After enabling Stream, upload videos to get an embed code in minutes. View [developer documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/stream/) to learn more.
billing.lego_contract.card.description.i: Images is an image platform that allows you to store, resize and deliver images affordably. View [developer documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/images/) to learn more.
billing.lego_contract.card.signed.argo: Note: Your request has been approved. You may now enable Argo.
billing.lego_contract.card.description.a:
Argo is a service that uses optimized routes across the Cloudflare network to deliver responses to your users more quickly, reliably, and securely.

Enabling Argo activates Argo Smart Routing and Tiered Caching, reducing Internet latency on average by more than 30% and connection errors by 27%.
billing.lego_contract.card.signed.bot_ma: **Note:** Your request has been approved. You may now add Bot Management.
billing.lego_contract.card.description.b: Gain deeper control over your automated traffic with granular bot protection, anomaly detection, and path-level control.

Block, challenge, or log bad bots on the Internet. Easily identify attacks with Bot Analytics. 

**Bot Management is available as an add-on service on the Enterprise plan.**

billing.lego_contract_purchase.disclaime:
By clicking "%{buttonText}", you agree to our Terms and Privacy Policy, and consent to enroll your subscription(s) in our automatic renewal service. Automatic renewals may be cancelled at any time via the Billing page in your account. Automatic renewals will be billed to the payment method on file, until canceled.

Please note that if you cancel your subscription mid-month you will still be charged for the entire month. For more information on Cloudflare's billing, renewal, and cancellation policies please visit [www.cloudflare.com/terms](https://www.cloudflare.com/terms).

By clicking "Purchase" you agree that you are purchasing a month-to-month subscription to the Service(s) above which will automatically renew unless you cancel your subscription to such Service(s) through your account dashboard before the beginning of your next monthly billing period. Please note that if you cancel your subscription mid-month you will still be charged for the entire month. Cancellation of the Services(s) above will not release you from any payment obligations that you may have for any other Service(s) that you previously purchased as part of an annual or multi-year Enterprise subscription.
billing.lego_contract_purchase.descripti:
Includes support for the following identity providers:

  • Facebook
  • Google
  • GitHub
  • Yandex
  • Passwordless
  • GSuite
  • Okta
  • OneLogin
  • Centrify
  • AzureAD
  • Generic SAML
  • Generic OIDC

In addition to:

  • Monitoring from all Cloudflare 300+ data centers
  • Health checks as often as every 5 seconds
  • Routing traffic to the fastest pool based on measured latency from health checks (Dynamic steering)
  • Routing traffic to specific pools based on the Cloudflare region serving the request (Geo steering)
  • Per PoP Geo steering
  • Analytics with history for up to 90 days

In addition to:

  • Storage for your videos
  • Multi-bitrate encoding
  • Stream Player (you can also use your own player)
Storage You only pay for the length of your original video. Example: Even if your 10-minute video is encoded into 6 different bit rates, you will only pay for 10 minutes (instead of 60 minutes).

In addition to:

  • Includes 10 million Bundled requests per month1
  • Includes first 1 million Unbound requests, 400,000 GB-sec duration, 5 GB egress data2
  • Up to 30 seconds duration per request
  • Always lowest latency
  • Up to 30 Workers
  • Global deployments to hundreds of data centers
  • Maintenance-free infrastructure that scales automatically
  • High performance runtime with no cold starts
  • Native JavaScript and WebAssembly support
  • Full CLI deployment capabilities

Durable Objects:

  • 1 million requests
  • 400,000 GB-second duration
  • 1 million read, 1 million write, 1 million delete operations.3

* Read and write units are metered in 4KB increments.

Key-value storage:

  • Up to 100 namespaces
  • 1 GB of storage
  • 10 million read, 1 million write, 1 million delete, and 1 million list operations.4

**Argo is a usage based product.**
You will be billed on the amount of data transferred between Cloudflare and your visitors. This covers all data from Cloudflare's edge, regardless of whether it originated from origin, cache hit or otherwise. It does not include DDoS traffic.

**Bot Management is a usage based product.**
You will be billed on the HTTP requests that reach your site.

billing.plan_card.description.lite: For small websites that aren't business-critical.
billing.plan_card.description.pro: For professional websites that aren't business-critical.
billing.plan_card.description.pro_plus: For small businesses maintaining websites and applications.
billing.plan_card.description.business: For growing small businesses operating online.

billing.plan_card.cloudflare_rules.toolt: Cloudflare Rules allows you to make adjustments to requests and responses, configure Cloudflare settings, and trigger specific actions for matching requests. Each Rules product has its own limits, this is a cumulative quota for reference. <0>Learn more</0>
billing.plan_card.waf_rules.tooltip: You can use WAF Custom Rules to perform both user agent blocking and zone lockdown. Learn More
billing.plan_card.experiment.ddos_protec: Unlimited and unmetered application layer (layer 7) DDoS attack mitigation.
billing.plan_card.experiment.ip_rate_lim: Limit the number of requests a certain IP address can make, and prevent abuse from 'repeat offender' IP addresses.
billing.plan_card.experiment.waf_protect: Protect against high severity and widespread  vulnerabilities with WAF

Protect against high severity and widespread vulnerabilities such as Shellshock and Log4J using Cloudflare's Free Managed Ruleset for Web Application Firewall (WAF). It is safe to deploy on most applications and is automatically deployed.
billing.plan_card.experiment.challenge_b: Detect and challenge common bots only
For an individual website. Challenge easy-to-detect bad bots from popular cloud providers.
billing.plan_card.experiment.ssl_cert.to: Secure your site and avoid browser security warnings and search engine deprioritization by using the free universal SSL / TLS certificates issued to all domains added to and activated on Cloudflare. Only supports the root or first-level subdomain.
billing.plan_card.experiment.easy_to_use: Cloudflare DNS is an enterprise-grade authoritative DNS service that offers the fastest response time, unparalleled redundancy, and advanced security with built-in DDoS mitigation and DNSSEC.
Improve performance, reduce load times, & lower costs by delivering static and dynamic content ultra-fast on Cloudflareu2019s vast global network.
billing.plan_card.experiment.owasp_prote: Protect against zero-day and common attacks including OWASP vulnerabilities with WAF

Deploy the OWASP Core Ruleset to protect against a variety of common threats such as cross-site scripting (XSS) and SQL injection (SQLi) which can lead to data breaches, theft, and reputational damage. 

Deploy the Cloudflare Managed Ruleset to mitigate the newest cyber attacks (zero-day vulnerabilities) and reduce false positives based on insights from the entire Cloudflare network. Protection from attacks on one application is extended to the entire Cloudflare community within seconds.
billing.plan_card.experiment.detect_stol: Perform automated credentials checks against a public database of stolen credentials and pass security headers to your application to trigger fraud mitigation. Deploy using Cloudflare's Exposed Credentials Check Managed Ruleset for WAF.
billing.plan_card.experiment.challenge_e: Enable Super Bot Fight mode to block and challenge easy-to-detect bad bots from any source. Plus, bypass bot settings using WAF Custom Rules.
billing.plan_card.experiment.load_assets: Prioritized loading of key site assets
Enable your server rather than visitorsu2019 browsers to make prioritization decisions about which site resources are loaded first using Enhanced HTTP/2 Prioritization.
billing.plan_card.experiment.wordpress_p: Optimize your WordPress site by using the Automatic Platform Optimization (APO) plugin for CDN, intelligent caching, and more. Turn it on and go.
billing.plan_card.experiment.one_click_i: Speed up your site by automatically reducing image sizes where possible. Use Polish to apply lossless or lossy compression to remove redundant bytes from images and use Mirage to accelerate image delivery based on your visitor's device screen size.
billing.plan_card.experiment.cache_cdn_o: Use Cache Analytics to see what site assets cannot be served by the Cloudflare CDN because they are missing, expired, or ineligible for caching. Then, employ these insights to make changes to increase the number of cached resources and improve site speed.
billing.plan_card.experiment.unknown_waf: Protect against  unknown application vulnerabilities with WAF

Leverage WAF Attack Score Liteu2019s machine learning models to detect and stop attacks that bypass existing security settings. WAF Attack Score Liteu2019s scoring currently indicates the likelihood of cross site scripting (XSS), SQL injection (SQLi), and remote code execution (RCE) attacks. Stop attacks by creating WAF Custom Rules based on the attack score.
billing.plan_card.experiment.pci_soc: PCI and SOC 2 Type II compliance
billing.plan_card.experiment.pci_soc.too:
All organizations that process transactions with credit, debit, and/or prepaid cards are subject to Payment Card Industry (PCI) compliance requirements. Cloudflare maintains PCI DSS 3.2 Level 1 compliance. Cloudflare's WAF and CDN are PCI compliant solutions. 

Cloudflare has undertaken the AICPA SOC 2 Type II certification to attest to Security, Confidentiality, and Availability controls in place in accordance to the AICPA Trust Service Criteria. Cloudflare's SOC 2 Type II report covers security, confidentiality, and availability controls to protect customer data.
billing.plan_card.experiment.malicious_s: Detect malicious 3rd-party scripts on web apps and receive alerts

Enable Page Shield to help you protect your visitors from Magecart-style attacks by receiving notifications about newly detected scripts, scripts loaded from unknown domains, or code changes in your existing scripts.
billing.plan_card.experiment.custom_ssl_: Use your own SSL certificates rather than Cloudflareu2019s universal SSL. Leveraging Custom SSL allows you to maintain control of issuance and renewal and allows SSL support for second, third, and fourth-level subdomains.
billing.plan_card.experiment.sophisticat: Block or challenge sophisticated bots (highly variable traffic signatures and novel bot attacks) using machine learning. Includes basic analytics for the last 7 days. Plus, bypass bot settings using WAF Custom Rules. Requires enablement of Super Bot Fight Mode.
billing.plan_card.experiment.custom_name: With custom (or vanity) nameservers, a domain can use Cloudflare DNS without using Cloudflare branded nameservers.
billing.plan_card.experiment.uptime_guar: Cloudflare commits to serving your content 100% of the time without qualification.
billing.plan_card.experiment.advanced_wa:
Advanced WAF enhances application and API protections with account level WAF management, threat intelligence, machine learning detections to complement WAF Custom Rules, file upload scanning, sensitive data detection, exposed credential checks, and highly accurate API-based rate limiting. 

Advanced Rate Limiting allows counting requests based on virtually any characteristics of the HTTP request, regardless of its source IP.
billing.plan_card.experiment.advanced_dd: Built to protect complex web apps and websites at scale. Advanced DDoS Protection learns your traffic profile, provides tailored security recommendations, gives you more granular DDoS attack detection methods and enables you to set up configurations for different parts of your applications. Layer 3 and 4 DDoS protection is also available.
billing.plan_card.experiment.api_gateway: Discover, secure, and manage your public APIs by consolidating web application and API protection on the Cloudflare edge. Includes machine learning driven API discovery, schema learning, rate limit recommendations, OWASP API Top 10, business logic abuse, and denial of service protection. Schema, JWT authentication and mutual TLS based traffic validation available.
billing.plan_card.experiment.enterprise_: Detect sophisticated bots on multiple web apps and complex web workflows using behavioral anomaly detection, machine learning and improved JavaScript detection. Multiple deployment options through JavaScript (using Turnstile) and our WAF. Granular responses on per path, per API, per bot basis. Detailed per bot analytics for the last 30 days.
billing.plan_card.experiment.logs.toolti: Detailed logs that contain metadata generated by Cloudflareu2019s products.
billing.plan_card.experiment.sso_support: Allow secure access to the Cloudflare dashboard using the identity provider of your choice.
billing.plan_card.experiment.customer_su: Includes a designated Customer Success Manager, CS led onboarding assistance, annual health check, monthly operational review, and access to an Enterprise customer portal. Designated technical account manager (TAM) and SOC add-ons available.

billing.enterprise_enablement.descriptio: Protect against denial-of-service attacks, brute-force login attempts, API traffic surges, account takeover attempts, bots scraping sensitive data, and other types of abuse targeting APIs and applications.
Develop Web3 applications without having to worry about running infrastructure. Access content from Web3 networks without installing special software or giving up storage.

Access the Ethereum network without installing software. Read agreed-upon information of existing nodes and write your own transactions and smart contracts to be stored by these nodes in a distributed manner.
A read-only, HTTP-accessible interface to the Interplanetary File System (IPFS). No need to download any software or give up storage space on your computer.
Identify and address API vulnerabilities with Cloudflare's API security, management, and monitoring services.
billing.enterprise_enablement.bullet.adv: Mitigate excessive request rates for for traffic matching any specific HTTP characteristic, or for an entire domain.
Count traffic on specific API attributes like tokens, API keys or cookies for API usage limits.
Block above-threshold requests with an HTTP 429 response that includes a Retry-After header.
Integrate with Cloudflare Web Application Firewall (WAF) and our application security portfolio.
Get unmetered Advanced Rate Limiting as an Enterprise customer.
billing.enterprise_enablement.bullet.api: API Discovery: map out and understand your attack surface area
Volumetric Abuse Detection: set up a system of adaptive rate limiting
Mutual TLS (mTLS): use client certificates to ensure traffic between client and server is bidirectionally secure and trusted
Schema Validation: check if incoming traffic complies with a previously supplied API schema. API Shield creates log-or-block rules for incoming traffic from the schema definitions
Endpoint Management: Monitor the health of your API endpoints by saving, updating, and monitoring performance metrics
billing.enterprise_enablement.descriptio: With the Workers Developer Platform, run your application code on the Cloudflare network to execute as close to end users as possible with scale, performance, security, and reliability built in.
billing.enterprise_enablement.bullet.wor: Run your code within 100ms of 95% of the global Internet population with Workers
Build and run stateful applications with Durable Objects
Use a secure low-latency key-value store on the Cloudflare network with Workers KV
Skip time-wasting deployment steps with a straight line from writing code to production, without worrying about scalability
billing.enterprise_enablement.descriptio: Enable to get additional rooms and queueing methods, event scheduling, customizable templates, session renewal disabling, and mobile app traffic support.
Build a scalable image pipeline on Cloudflare servers to store, resize, optimize, and deliver images in a fast and secure manner.
billing.enterprise_enablement.bullet.a.i: With the APIu2019s Direct Creator Upload, let your users upload pictures with a one-time upload URL and accept uploads without exposing your API key or token to the client
billing.enterprise_enablement.bullet.b.i: Migrate images to Cloudflare without fetching them first by uploading them via URL in the API
billing.enterprise_enablement.bullet.c.i: Specify a path to upload images instead of the path automatically generated by Cloudflare Imagesu2019 Universal Unique Identifier (UUID) by using Custom IDs in the API
billing.enterprise_enablement.card.descr:
Increase cache lifetimes by automatically storing all cacheable files into Cloudflare's persistent object storage buckets.
When there's a cache miss Cloudflare will first check these storage buckets before going to your origin.
Cached files are stored with a 30 day time-to-live (TTL), refreshed on cache hits.
Use with Tiered Cache for maximum origin sheilding.
billing.enterprise_enablement.descriptio: Improve application performance and availability by distributing traffic to the most available and responsive server pools.
billing.enterprise_enablement.feature.ti: Speed and reliability with intelligent routing and automatic failover
billing.enterprise_enablement.feature.de:
* Distribute traffic evenly across your healthy servers, automatically failing over when a server is unhealthy or unresponsive.
* Choose whether to distribute requests based on server latency, a visitor's geographic region, or a visitor's GPS coordinates.

* Customize rules for the behavior of your load balancer based on the characteristics of individual requests.
* Monitor your servers at configurable intervals and across multiple data centers to look for specific status codes, response text, and timeouts.
* Review comprehensive analytics to evaluate traffic flow, assess origin health status, and review changes in pools and pool health over time.
* Seamless integration with the Cloudflare product suite

The Cloudflare Load Balancing API has full parity with the UI, plus additional APIs:
  • PoP-level geo steering
  • A region mapping API
  • The ability to list and/or search pool references
  • Consecutive up/down filters for load balancing monitor configuration
  • And more!
API Reference Documentation
billing.enterprise_enablement.card.descr:
Increase cache lifetimes by automatically storing all cacheable files into Cloudflare's persistent object storage buckets.
When there's a cache miss Cloudflare will first check these storage buckets before going to your origin.
Cached files are stored with a 30 day time-to-live (TTL), refreshed on cache hits.
Use with Tiered Cache for maximum origin sheilding.
billing.enterprise_enablement.descriptio: Extend Cloudflare's benefits to customers using your service by adding them to your zone as custom hostnames, routing traffic from them to an origin set up on your domain. Cloudflare for SaaS is highly customizable, and gives your customers the benefits below. Get started with 100 custom hostnames.
billing.enterprise_enablement.bullet.ssl: Bot Management and WAF Custom Rules (add-ons)
billing.enterprise_enablement.descriptio: Improve performance with no development effort. Argo uses optimized routes across the Cloudflare network for an average 35% decrease in latency, 27% decrease in connection errors, and 60% decrease in cache misses.
billing.enterprise_enablement.bullet.arg: Route around brownouts, cable cuts, packet loss, and other congestion, based on real-time global network information.
Get the same last-mile improvements for both dynamic and static traffic with tiered caching.
Secure all traffic with end-to-end encryption.
Reduce costs of latency, server load, and bandwidth usage.
billing.enterprise_enablement.descriptio: Advanced Certificate Manager is a flexible and customizable way to manage your certificates and TLS settings on Cloudflare.
billing.enterprise_enablement.bullet.a.a: Include up 50 hostnames on a certificate
billing.enterprise_enablement.bullet.e.a: Control the cipher suites used for TLS connections
billing.enterprise_enablement.bullet.f.a: Use the Custom Origin Trust store to upload CAs for origin authentication
billing.enterprise_enablement.descriptio: Upload, store, encode, and deliver live and on-demand video with one API.
billing.enterprise_enablement.feature.ti: Build video features into your own website or native app
billing.enterprise_enablement.feature.de: **Let your users upload their own videos** Generate a unique URL that you can send to your users, allowing them to upload videos directly to Cloudflare, through the location closest to them. Learn more. **Let your users stream live video at scale** Use Stream to allow your users to stream their own live video, without configuring or managing any servers or infrastructure of your own. Learn more. **Control access to on-demand videos and live streams** Stream provides an API that allows you to generate your own signed URLs, allowing you to restrict access to only signed-in users, only users in specific locations, or for limited periods of time. Learn more.
billing.enterprise_enablement.feature.ti: Stream live video at global scale
billing.enterprise_enablement.feature.de: **Ingestion and delivery via Cloudflare's Global Network** You or your users stream live video to the Cloudflare location nearest to you, and Cloudflare delivers video from the location closest to viewers. No need to setup or configure a CDN. **Support for all standard protocols** Stream live video using RTMPS or SRT, and play live video using HLS and DASH. Learn more. **Instantly available recordings of live streams** Live streams are automatically recorded and instantly made available to view after a live stream ends. Learn more.

**Play live and on-demand video on any device, in browsers and native apps** Stream uses open standards supported by all browsers and devices, allowing you to play live and on-demand video on any platform, and customize exactly what viewers see. Learn more. **Add video playback to your website without writing code** Stream provides an integrated web player that you can add to any website by copying and pasting a simple embed code. Learn more.

**Analyze viewing patterns by location, time, device, and more** Use Stream's GraphQL analytics API to query both server-side and client-side analytics to understand when and where people are watching live and on-demand video. Learn more. **Understand the top video creators in your app** Set a Creator ID for on-demand videos and live streams, and use this in your analytics queries to understand which users are creating the most viewed video content. Learn more. **Get real-time viewer counts for live streams** Show other viewers how many people are watching a given live stream. Learn more.
Read the Stream Developer Docs and API Reference Documentation

caching.tiered_cache.analytics_availabil: Tiered Cache analytics are currently only available for Smart Tiered Cache Topology.
You can update your topology in the<0> Traffic Tab</0> under the Argo section.
caching.cache_topology_card.help: With Smart Tiered Cache Topology, Cloudflare will identify the Cloudflare data centers closest to your origin and only allow these data centers to pull from your origin, saving you bandwidth and processing power at your origin.
caching.cache_topology_card.title: Tiered Cache Topology
caching.cache_topology_card.description:
Selecting your cache topology allows you to control how your origin connects to Cloudflareu2019s data centers to help ensure higher cache hit ratios, fewer origin connections, and a reduction of Internet latency.

**Smart Tiered Cache Topology** instructs Cloudflare to find the single best upper tier(s) for your origin(s).

**Generic Global Tiered Topology** instructs Cloudflare to use its representative sample of global data centers as a network of upper tiers.

**Custom Tiered Cache Topology** allows you to work with Cloudflareu2019s support team to set a custom topology that fits your specific needs. If you want a custom topology, please contact your CSM.
caching.cache_topology_card.short_descri: Selecting your cache topology allows you to control how your origin connects to Cloudflareu2019s data centers to help ensure higher cache hit ratios, fewer origin connections, and a reduction of Internet latency.
caching.cache_topology_card.cache_analyt: View cache topology analytics under the<0> Cache tab</0>.
caching.cache_topology_card.control.opti: Instructs Cloudflare to check a regional data center near the lower tier before going to the upper tier that may be outside of the region. This can help improve performance for smart and custom tiered cache topologies.
Instructs Cloudflare to dynamically identify the optimal upper tier(s) closest to your origin(s), with the objective of minimizing origin resource consumption.
Instructs Cloudflare to use a distributed sample of large global data centers as upper tiers, with the objective of providing increased performance to those with significant global traffic.

developer_platform.workers.create.subhea: Run secure code globally with rapid response times, zero cold-starts, and automatic scaling.
developer_platform.workers.create.sample: Here's a sample Worker to get started
Next, you'll be able to modify or replace the sample code using the web editor or Wrangler CLI, and deploy your Worker.
This HTTP handler takes an HTTP request and returns 'hello world'

developer_platform.workers.edit.cli.desc: Build, preview, and deploy Workers from the Wrangler command line interface.
developer_platform.workers.edit.cli.depe: You will need to have npm and Node.js installed. Wrangler requires a Node version of 16.13.0 or later.
developer_platform.workers.edit.cli.step: This creates a new project folder called "myproject" containing your sample worker and the necessary configuration files.
Change your directory to your new "myproject" folder
Initiate a new deploy and Wrangler will open a new window so you can log in to your Cloudflare account. Follow in the in-line inustructions to finish deploying and viewing your worker.
Your Worker is now live in 275+ global locations

edge_traffic_order_nav.title: Traffic sequence
edge_traffic_order_nav.configuration_rul: Change Cloudflare settings for matching incoming requests.
edge_traffic_order_nav.dynamic_redirects: Perform powerful URL redirects with expression-defined target URLs.
edge_traffic_order_nav.description: Traffic to your application runs through the following sequence on Cloudflare's edge:
edge_traffic_order_nav.large_description: The simplified journey of a request as it proxies through Cloudflare. Use <0>Trace</0> to review how your specific configuration impacts traffic.
edge_traffic_order_nav.cache_rules.descr: Cache Rules let you control which Cloudflare settings trigger on a given URL.
edge_traffic_order_nav.ddos.description: Cloudflare's automated DDoS protection systems constantly analyze traffic and generate real-time signatures to mitigate attacks across the network and application layers. These mitigations are automatically enabled for all customers across all plans.
edge_traffic_order_nav.url_rewrites.desc: Use Transform Rules to transform your traffic. This includes URL Normalization, URL Rewrites, and Header Modifications. Transformed traffic is then used as input for other Cloudflare products.
edge_traffic_order_nav.origin_rules.desc: Origin Rules let you control where matching traffic goes and with which parameters.
edge_traffic_order_nav.page_rules.descri: Page Rules let you control which Cloudflare settings trigger on a given URL. Only one Page Rule will trigger per URL, so it is helpful if you sort Page Rules in priority order, and make your URL patterns as specific as possible.
edge_traffic_order_nav.ip_access_rules.d: IP Access Rules can be based on IP address, IP address range, Autonomous System Number (ASN) or country.
edge_traffic_order_nav.rate_limiting.des: Protect your site or API from malicious traffic by blocking client IP addresses that hit a URL pattern and exceed a threshold you define. Your existing Rate Limiting Rules are listed below. This feature is a usage-based product. Learn more about how billing works for Rate Limiting.
edge_traffic_order_nav.firewall_rules.de: Control incoming traffic to your zone by filtering requests based on location, IP address, user agent, URI, and more.
edge_traffic_order_nav.bot_management.de: View a traffic breakdown and manage bots with simple controls
edge_traffic_order_nav.managed_rules.des: The Web Application Firewall protects your application by analyzing characteristics from each request and determining how the request should be completed.
edge_traffic_order_nav.access.descriptio: Connect any user to any application and private network faster and more securely than a VPN by enforcing identity and context- based rules and limiting lateral movement.
edge_traffic_order_nav.waf.description: The Web Application Firewall protects your application by analyzing characteristics from each request and determining how the request should be completed.
edge_traffic_order_nav.cloud_connector.d: Cloud Connector allows you to route matching incoming traffic from your website to a public cloud provider that you define such as AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure.
edge_traffic_order_nav.workers.descripti: Build serverless applications and deploy instantly across the globe for exceptional performance, reliability, and scale.
edge_traffic_order_nav.snippets.descript: Snippets provide a flexible and powerful way to customize the behavior of your website or application using short pieces of JavaScript code. Create snippets to customize HTTP response headers, implement JWT validation, define complex redirect functionality, and more. Each snippet has an associated rule that defines when the snippet will run.
edge_traffic_order_nav.load_balancing.de: Safeguard from service disruptions with load balancing, automatic failover, geographic routing, and active health checks against your origin servers.
edge_traffic_order.survey.text: We've added Traffic sequence. <0>Tell us what you think.</0>

If you have lost all of your 2nd factor autentication (2FA) devices, then you can use a browser you successfully logged in recently from to recover access. For security reasons, you will need to wait 3 days to receive a temporary access code after completing verification.

Alternatively, if you have your backup codes or another 2FA device configured on your account, you can use one of them to log in here and then disable your lost device. If you have tried this without success, proceed to click Begin Recovery below.

dns-firewall.card.description: You can add groups of DNS servers for Cloudflare to upstream queries to. Each group of DNS servers is called a u2018clusteru2019. Itu2019s important that each cluster contains nameservers that all share the same data so that Cloudflare can send queries directed to that cluster to any nameserver within that cluster.
dns-firewall.card.enter_a_name: Please enter a name for this DNS Firewall Cluster.
dns-firewall.card.max_name_length: Name must be at most ${max} characters
dns-firewall.card.help:
#### What is DNS Firewall?
DNS Firewall is a DNS proxy where queries destined for a DNS provideru2019s nameservers are first sent through Cloudflare. Cloudflare then either responds from cache or fetches the answer from the upstream origins.
#### What is a DNS Cluster?
A DNS Cluster is a group of nameservers that contain the same data.  When Cloudflare receives a DNS query destined for one of the nameservers in that cluster, it chooses the most performant server within that cluster to fetch the answer from. 
#### How does the maximum and minimum cache TTL work?
Cloudflareu2019s DNS Firewall proxy cache respects the cache TTLs on DNS records within a maximum and minimum that you can configure per DNS cluster. The benefit of setting a high maximum TTL is to increase the cache hit ratio, improving the speed of your DNS answers and reducing the load your origin servers need to handle. However, a higher maximum TTL also means that you will need to wait extra time for DNS records to update when changes to them are made.
#### What does it mean if ANY queries are turned off?
ANY queries are a built-in debugging tool, meant to return every DNS record that exist for a name. Unfortunately, they are instead more often used for launching large DDoS attacks. Cloudflare stopped answering ANY queries for its own DNS traffic in September 2015 and published [this Internet Draft](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-jabley-dnsop-refuse-any) to propose this as a wider solution. If you would like to deprecate ANY queries on your DNS traffic, then you can turn on u2018Deprecate ANYu2019 and Cloudflare will answer automatically to ANY with an HINFO record:

`HINFO     "Please stop asking for ANY"  "See draft-ietf-dnsop-refuse-any"`

carbon.description: Along with our mission of helping build a better Internet, we are passionate about protecting the world we live in. Not only does your usage of Cloudflare reduce total carbon emissions, but Cloudflare also purchases renewable energy credits (RECs) on behalf of all of our customers to power 100% of our network by renewable energy, including the <0></0> attributed to your account's usage specifically u2014 hereu2019s <1>how we got that number</1>.<2></2><3>Check out our blog post</3> for more details.
carbon.go_green.title: <0>Go green</0> with Cloudflare
carbon.go_green.description: Did you know Cloudflare already offers ways to help reduce your carbon impact? Check out some of our recommendations below and optimize your website in the process.
carbon.workers.title: Workers, Durable Objects, Pages
carbon.workers.description: Use Workers, Durable Objects, or Pages to host your content. Cloudflare offsets carbon emissions by purchasing Renewable Energy Certificates to match 100% of the power used in all of our data centers and offices around the world (certified by Green Web Foundation).
carbon.image_resizing.title: Image Resizing
carbon.image_resizing.description: Use Cloudflareu2019s Image Resizing for visual content on your site. Properly resizing images reduces the energy it takes each of your end users to load a page, thus reducing downstream carbon emissions.
carbon.cloud_security.title: Cloud Security
carbon.cloud_security.description: Use Cloudflareu2019s cloud security and performance services such as WAF, network firewall, and DDoS Mitigation. The more cloud services you use, the more of your on-premise boxes you can retire. Decommissioning hardware reduces your carbon footprint!
carbon.other_tips.title: Other tips to go green
carbon.other_tips.description: Outside of Cloudflare, there are other ways that you could start optimizing your website to reduce your carbon footprint. Learn about other ways to go green below.
carbon.website_optimization.title: Website optimization
carbon.website_optimization.description: Design your website with sustainability in mind: not auto-playing videos, trimming down bulky Javascript, and avoiding custom fonts can all help reduce the energy that it takes to power your website.
carbon.recs.title: Purchase Renewable Energy Credits (RECs)
carbon.recs.description: Offset your carbon usage: consider purchasing RECs to offset your domainu2019s carbon usage.
carbon.share_message: Choosing to have my websites protected by Cloudflare saved
carbon.how_calculated: See how we calculated your savings
carbon.account_created_after: Based on the recency of this account's creation date, we do not have annual information available yet related to carbon impact.
carbon.caculated.title: How we calculated your impact
carbon.caculated.description: Your account's carbon usage was calculated by examining your usage of Cloudflare services as a percentage of Cloudflare's total energy consumption. It does not include L3/4 services such as Magic Transit.
carbon.caculated.savings.title: How we calculated your savings
carbon.caculated.savings.description: Your carbon savings were calculated by comparing the average carbon emitted for your data transfer volume using other Internet services (<0>source</0>) to the estimated carbon emissions from your use of Cloudflare services.
